overview: This subject follows Music Language 1 and 2 in chronological sequence, providing an overview of modern compositional directions, styles and techniques found Western music from 1900 through to the present day.

Set works are viewed, heard and analysed through the construction process of the composer. Students compose short, original pieces (assignments) using these techniques and styles which are performed or presented in tutorials.
ilo: demonstrate a working knowledge of the principal 20th-century techniques;
apply technical and expressive insight to compositional processes;
collaborate with fellow musicians on practical realisation of compositional ideas.
generic_skills: absorb and analyse models and replicate them;
connect modes of communication with contexts in which they arise.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.hurdle: Students must attend a minimum of 80% of all scheduled classes.

Students must submit all elements of assessment to be eligible for a pass in this subject. For the purposes of meeting this hurdle requirement, each submitted assessment must be complete and constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task. Submitting only part of an assessment (e.g. only the title page) or an assessment on an irrelevant topic will not meet this hurdle requirement.

date_times.contact_hours: 36 hours, comprising two 2-hour lectures and one 2-hour tutorial per week.
36 hours, comprising two 1-hour lectures and one 1-hour tutorial per week.
